tool.name: Virtual Suppressor Strain
tool.description: generates a genome with specified stop codons suppressed
tool.command:
bin/cpt_virtual_suppressor_strain.pl --galaxy --outfile_supporting $__new_file_path__ --file "${file}"
#for $item in $repeat_suppress: --suppress "${item.suppress}" #end for
#for $item in $repeat_replacement: --replacement "${item.replacement}" #end for
#if $translate: --translate #end if
--results "${results}"
--results_files_path "${results.files_path}"
--results_format "${results_format}"
--results_id "${results.id}"
--modified_features "${modified_features}"
--modified_features_files_path "${modified_features.files_path}"
--modified_features_format "${modified_features_format}"
--modified_features_id "${modified_features.id}"

param.name: suppress
param.help: Suppress this stop codon. All features with this codon will be extended to the next available stop codon.
param.label: suppress

param.name: replacement
param.help: Replace a suppressed stop codon with a user specified amino acid. Defaults to an N (because of bioperl restrictions), but this should be replaced with an 1 letter amino acid. This option is ONLY used if you also specify to translate the sequence below
param.label: replacement

tool.help:
NAME ====
Virtual Suppressor Strain
DESCRIPTION ===========
Given (one or more, mutli-genome) genbank file(s), this tool will extend features past specific stop codon types, suppressing them. It will also produce a fasta DNA sequence for modified features, allowing further investigation of those features which changed.
Acknowledgements ================
This tool was developed with significant input from Dr. Jason Gill @ TAMU
